article.headline: Providence 78, Rutgers 63
article.story: PROVIDENCE, R.I. (AP) -- Herbert Hill had 20 points and 13 rebounds to lead Providence to a 78-63 victory over Rutgers in the Big East action. Hill recorded his third straight double-double effort. Geoff McDermott added 19 points, 8 rebounds and 6 assists for the Friars (13-5, 3-2). Marques Webb had 17 points and Anthony Farmer 16 for the Scarlet Knights (8-11, 1-5), who suffered their fourth straight loss. Hill also had five blocks to help Providence outscore Rutgers 46-24. Providence scored 15 points off nine Rutgers turnovers. McDermott and Hill each had eight points in the first half when the Friars built a 31-22 lead helped by separate 12-0 runs. Webb hit successive three-pointers just before intermission to help cut what had been a 15-point Friar margin to nine. Sharaud Curry's two free throws gave the Friars their largest lead, 61-43, with less than six minutes left. Webb cut the deficit to 67-57 on his third three-pointer with three minutes left but that was the closest Rutgers would get. J.R Inman, Rutgers leading scorer, was held to just 5 points on 2-of-12 shooting.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
